A LARGE GLASS JAR containing a DEFORMED BABY. The pickled punk looks to have a small second head growing from its  temple. The label on the jar reads STUFFY 1973. The sound from the TV fades up in the background. BELA LUGOSI'S VOICE can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands, please. Your left hand  shows your past...

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: Bela is seen as a fortune teller holding a woman's hands. This is a scene from The Wolfman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and your right hand shows your  future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a tight shot of the woman's palm. A pentagram appe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK from the TV to find Donald Willis sitting in old easy chair. The room is modest, but comfortable. He reaches over and picks up a small alarm clock, notices the time, concerned look comes over his face. The phone rings. He quickly answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Denise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappointment. He mutes the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah... no, Fred. I was hoping  you were Denise, she's a little late. (pausing) Yeah, yeah I'm sure the rain just  slowed 'em down... yeah... uh-huh,  yeah... no, no you can keep it 'til  Tuesday... alright, talk to ya  tomorrow, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unmutes the sound on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feast is on. Mother, Tiny, Grampa, Jerry, Bill, Mary Denise are gathered around the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, everyone, put on your masks. We  can't very well eat with our everyday  faces exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother puts on her mask, Tiny and Grampa follow. Jerry, B and Denise slowly raise up their masks, Mary hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mary) Christ kid, put it on. She ain't  letting any of us touch the grub  'til you're wearing the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary rolls her eyes and complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been meaning to ask you, Mrs...  Ummmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Firefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firefly... mmmmm odd name. Mrs.  Firefly, do you know anything about  the legend of Dr. Satan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grampa shifts his eyes onto Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Well, I'm not much for local gossip  an this and that, but I've heard it  mentioned in passing over the years  but... I mean folks is queer and  they say things, crazy things you  know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all talk, yakty yak, like a  bunch of hungry chipmunks... Christ,  Dr. Satan. That takes the bull's  nuts alright... (starts laughing) ...hey, I hear some genius up north  got a hot line on the Easter Bunny  for ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PALE FIGURE creeps forward like NOSFERATU from a dark c of the room. This is OTIS. He stands six foot, but is deathly slim. His skin is  translucent, glowing in the dark. Long thin white hair co his head. His eyes are grey. He is an ALBINO. He is holding a GLASS JAR containing a SMALL FETUS. On cl inspection we see there are two small bodies joined to on head. The label reads WOLF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy surprise) Otis! I can't believe you decided to  come down and join us... and you  brought little Wolf. This really is  a special night... all my babies  together.

dialogues.text: Otis sets the disturbing jar of Wolf on the table. He lea forward onto the jar, resting his chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I don't know where you heard  all your little fairy fables about  Dr. Satan but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a Captain Spaulding down at  some museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) That old bitch hog don't know shit.  He tells cute little tattle-tales to  sell his junk, but he don't sell no  Yankee boys no truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But something happened, right? I  mean the story is based on a real  incident, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) What are you, Jimmy Olsen cub reporter  for the Daily Asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grampa... watch the language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't sure that you really need to  know. It's better you go home still  dreaming about your kitty cats and  puppy dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the kid wants to know. Enlighten  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I bet you'd stick your head in  the fire if I told ya you'd see  Hell... meanwhile you too stupid to  realize you got a demon sticking out  your ass singing, "Holy Miss Moly, I  got a live one."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we please change the subject?

dialogues.text: What's he so excited about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no it's so much more special  than that... you'll see, you'll be  the first to ever see. I think this  is something you'll really love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.text: Billy, Jerry, Mary and Denise stand waiting in front of a old barn. Tiny unlocks the huge doors of the barn and swi them open. Standing inside waiting is Mother. She is all dressed up the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, come in... how many in your  party... (she counts the heads) ...one, two, three and four... right  this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother hands each of them a folded piece of paper, which  serves as a program book. Hand drawn on each is an orange pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Mother inside. Thousands of red Christmas lights hang down, strung throu the rotting wood rafters. Crates, barrels and an odd  assortment of chairs face a large quilted curtain. Fillin these seats are LIFELESS DUMMIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother motions toward four empty seats in the front row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) This is way too fucked up for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) I know the words... fucking psycho  fucking bullshit, that's the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just grin and bear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That food... (holding stomach) ugh, I feel like I'm gonna puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, Bill, Mary and Denise take their seats. Mary flips open the program. Inside, written in crayon, a the words: HALLOWEEN EXTRAVAGANZA -- starring the Comedy  Legend GRAMPA and the World Famous BABY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bill) Check this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, ya can't complain I never take  you anyplace.

dialogues.text: The sound of a warped crackling record fills the room. Lo music. A small spotlight hits the quilted curtain covering the s Mother Firefly stands behind the controls. She is smiling proudly. The curtain clumsily parts TO REVEAL: A stage set pieced together from amusement park wreckage. A giant painted plywood devil looms over the stage, surro by dancing skeletons and demon girls. A microphone stands center stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) I can't believe what I'm seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, this is fucking nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is starting to make me real  uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sit back and enjoy the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of CANNED APPLAUSE fills the room. Bill begins applaud, Jerry and Denise join in. Mary does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, straight from  his smash six week sold out run at  Tiki-Ti Club... the Stardust lounge  is proud to present Mr. Sexy  himself... Grampa Hugo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grampa walks out to center stage, mic in hand and begins speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let me tell ya a story... so  I'm hanging out with my buddy Hal  Jackowictz and I'm like, hey Hal  let's go get some booze and chase  the chickens... fucking Hal says no,  no the old battle axe at home will  break my balls... I gotta get my ass  home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids stare in shock at Grampa. Jerry begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I tell 'im... Hal, here's the  secret. Go home tonight, crawl into  bed, get under the covers and eat  your wife's pussy... I mean jam your  face right in the bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry starts to giggle.

dialogues.text: (quietly) What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I think he's funny.

dialogues.text: This isn't funny, it's twisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Hal goes home, jumps in, starts  chomping and licking away at her  pussy, she's screaming and howling...  totally passes out from the  experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God, let this end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Hal... He's feeling pretty good,  so he goes into the bathroom for a  quick shave... (pauses) ...suddenly he lets out a horrible  scream. Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recorded crowd chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting there on the toilet is Hal's  wife Gloria... and she says, "Quiet  down, you'll wake Grandma!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recorded crowd screams with laughter, as does Jerry. Bill, Denise and Mary look at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, you're too kind, too  kind... stay in your seats, coming  up next we got something special for  you men out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains close and the stage goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, I'm all for being a sport, but  this is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) Man, it's already ten thirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with Denise, can't we just walk  to someplace, this is getting fucking  stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Shit, we are so deep in  the sticks we could walk for hours  and find zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd say at this point all we  can do is just wait it out. There's  nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose. I mean they're obviously  all bonkers, but I guess they're  harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: The stage lights come up. The recorded applause and music begin. Baby enters the stage. She is dressed in a home-made show outfit. She begins to dance clumsily to the music. She ap to be somewhat intoxicated. The vocals come on and Baby begins to lipsync to the song

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me. This chick  is wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby makes her way down from stage on to floor level. She gyrates and seductively TEASES one of the dummy audience  members. Baby moves over to Jerry. Stroking her hand down his face Denise tries to look amused. Jerry smiles uncomfortably. Baby strolls past Denise and stops in front of Mary. Baby pauses and pinches Mary's cheek and winks. Mary is  FURIOUS. Baby moves over to Bill. Mary watches like a mother hawk. Baby sings and dances with all of her attention focused o Bill. dialogues.text: Take that, you fucking slut! (Mary spits at Baby) Fucking redneck whore!

dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.text: Bill begins to pull the car down the long dirt driveway  towards the road. The heavy rain makes visibility difficu

dialogues.text: Jesus, you think she was really gonna  cut you?

dialogues.text: SLAM! Suddenly, Baby pounds her fist against Mary's windo Mary jumps back in terror.

dialogues.text: It won't work.

dialogues.text: From a distance we see Jerry pulled from the car and beat The girls are helplessly trapped inside the destroyed veh The scarecrows continue to pound on the car. As we fade out, the sound of a BARKING DOG can be heard.

dialogues.text: From a long shot, we see the farmhouse in the early morni sunrise. All is still. The sound of an engine starting breaks the early morning  silence. Rufus's tow truck is seen pulling away from behi the house. The BEATEN REMAINS of Bill's car are towed beh it.

dialogues.text: Darkness, except for the face of an alarm clock. The time 7:00 AM. TICK, TICK, TICK... BUZZZZZZ. The alarm goes off A hand reaches over and turns off the alarm. We hear a de groan. A light turns on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don Willis wakes up, having fallen asleep in his easy cha He sits up and wipes the sleep from his eyes. He runs a h across his head, smoothing out his thinning grey hair. He picks up a phone next to his bed, dials a number, wait

dialogues.text: Hi. Lieutenant Broekman please...  Donald Willis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds.

dialogues.text: Willis stands, walks to the window, opens the shades, mor sun fills the room. shelf by the window is cluttered with framed photographs. B+W memories of Denise at the beach, RUDY the dog. High s graduations and Donald Willis in uniform with the other  members of 56 Precinct. Donald is a FORMER POLICE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little worried about Denise.  She called me last night from the  road, out by Ruggsville at some joint  called Spaulding's or something like  that, said she'd be here about  eleven... but she never showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, if you could run a check on up  that way and see about any accidents  or road closing or anything, I'd  really appreciate it... (listening) ...yeah, yeah, I know... I'm sure  nothing happened but, you know me I  like to worry... thanks... bye.

dialogues.text: Mary opens her eyes, squinting into the light. Sunlight p through filth on the windows, fractured by the tattered  remains of rotted curtains. Peeling yellowed newspaper se as wallpaper surrounding the window. Mary's eyes move across the walls to a painting of a BIG  EYED KITTEN. She stares at it and smiles. A look of horro begins to appear on her face. She begins to scream  uncontrollably.

dialogues.text: (off screen) Shut your fucking mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM BACK to see Mary wearing a dunce cap, tied to a chai facing a corner in the farmhouse's attic. This is Otis's studio. Otis, standing before a large canvas, sets down his paint brush and calmly walks over to Mary. He spins her chair around, clamps her mouth shut with his hand and leans his nose against hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Otis pulls back his hand, ready to backhand her across th face with the book. She nods again. He lowers the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing dramatically) And the angels, all pallid and wan,  Uprising, unveiling, affirm That the  play is the tragedy "Man" And its  hero the Conqueror Worm... (pauses) ...you get that? Art is eternal, you  get me, mamma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary stares dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I'm gonna remove my hand... you  make a sound and I swear I'll slit  you open and make you eat your own  fucking intestines... you get me?

dialogues.text: (whispering) Why? Why are you doing this?

dialogues.text: Doing what? Messy up your day? Well,  fuck lady there are some bigger issues  at hand... than your fucking have a  nice fucking day bumper sticker shit!

dialogues.text: Where's Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Well, Bill... he's a good guy, he's  been great help to me... a real  blessing... I couldn't have asked  for a better specimen. I mean you  don't know what a dry spell I've  had, total block... (slaps his forehead) ...total block... but Bill he's OK.

dialogues.text: Otis grabs the back of the chair and drags her across the room towards a curtained off area. Whoosh! He pulls her through the curtains. From behind th curtain we hear Mary SCREAMING and Otis LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: What'd you see, who was she with,  where were they going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, she was with some nosey, smartass  high-rise kids. They were poking  around... asking stupid questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Questions about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This and that, mostly some tired Dr.  Satan bullshit... they got a gander  at the display back there and thought  they could solve the great Deadwoods  mystery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I gave 'em directions out there,  up by the old farm row... I figured  what's the harm. Stupid kids probably  going out to piss up a rope and got  themselves turned around backasswards  and got lost as shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all... think real hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they weren't here but a few  minutes, didn't really have time to  get as up close and personal as I do  with most of the assholes that wander  through here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's about you give me those same  directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, sure. You don't have to  get all True Grit all over my ass...  I'll give'm to ya... you can knock  yourself silly for all I care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him a note pad) Enough talk, write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are cruising down the road. A bobbing head skeleton to glued to the dashboard wiggles with each bump in the road Behind the wheel is Rufus Jr., riding shotgun is Baby, dr in her Sunday best. The radio is blasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming over the  music) We're gonna have fun tonight, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They speed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police cruiser maneuvers down the rough dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell and Naish scan the surrounding woods for any sign Denise and her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, the way I see it is these kids  probally stop off somewhere, bought  a bunch of booze and are off getting  shitfaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're right, but my guts are  telling me different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Spidey senses tingling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... (realizes what he  just said) ...huh, what the hell are you talking  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your hyper sensitive Spidey  senses... like Spider-man... (pauses) ...you know, like in the comics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old do you think I am? I know  who the fuck Spider-man is. Get to  your point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, his senses start tingling...  when he was approaching danger and  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always favored the Hulk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hulk was dumb as shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's car is down in a ditch, run off the side of the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish checks the license plate number with his sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plates match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the chief... We found 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, crummy liquor store stands next to a sleazy mote A filthy looking hooker leads her customer to a waiting r a homeless bum stands screaming obscenities in the parkin lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The store is decorated for Halloween. Off to one side is a curtained room. A sign reads "XXX 8m loops", sex noises can be heard inside. Baby and Rufus stand at the counter waiting for the CASHI a skinny geek with glasses, to total up their purchases. counter is loaded with bottles. The cashier is packing the bottles into cardboard boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all having a Halloween party  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, what makes you think that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all sure are buying a lot of  holy water for two people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well we like to get fucked up  and do fucked up shit, you know what  I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... (giggling) ...I like to fuck shit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you do... how much we owe  ya... (looks at his name  tag) ...Goober?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down at his  tag) Actually it's G. Ober... Gerry Ober,  but the guys drew in the other O,  fucking assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uninterested) Great story Goober, how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummmm... two hundred and eighty-five  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby throws down three hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the change and get yourself a  new name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap, thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus picks up the boxes from the counter. He and Baby st to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, bro. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out a flyer) Hey, wait take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby stops and grabs the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A missing girl. I use'ta go to school  with her, she just up and disappeared  some day... real weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flyer reads MISSING, KAREN MURPHY, 18. The picture on the flyer shows the smiling chubby face of a young girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now isn't she a happy little cherub...  oh well (stuffs it in her  pocket) ...nobody just up and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters) Aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe it was fucking aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby and Rufus exit. Rufus loads the boxes into the back the truck. Baby sits on the curb and lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's car is now sitting in the middle of the road. The  back is attached to a police tow truck. An additional pol cruiser arrives on the scene. Sheriff Huston steps out from his cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd we here, Georgie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vehicle registered to a William S.  Hudley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Jesus, somebody had themselves  a field day beating the shit outta  this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no mercy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recover any bodies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inspecting the car) Shit, I wonder what these kids did  to bring this much hell down on 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in the wrong place at the wrong  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the understatement of the  year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, I suppose it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish is digging around under the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish crawls out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd ya got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Christ boy, don't stand there  like a prize dog dick with his  butthole caught up a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss 'em over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish tosses them over the car to Wydell. Wydell fishes  through the keys, finds the trunk key and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winces) God damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find something, Georgie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Yep, I found something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move around the car to see the nude body of Karen Murp laying in the trunk. Her arms and legs are hog tied. She dead. The word TRICK is carved into her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water drips down from the leaking pipes above. Scavenging rats scurry across the concrete floor. In a far corner a single light burns, a child's Humpty Du lamp, illuminating -- Denise is strapped to an old wooden bed. She has been str of her own clothes and is now wearing a blue checked litt girl's dress. Her hair is tied in pigtails. She is cold and shivering. BOOM. The basement door opens, heavy footsteps lumber dow the creaking stairs. It is Tiny. Tiny is wearing an orange T-shirt that reads, "This is my Halloween costume". For the first time we see the skin on his arms, it is severely deformed from burn scars. He is holding a small tray. On the tray is a box of cerea milk, a bowl and a spoon. Tiny goes over to Denise, sets down the tray, and proudly displays his T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarse and dry) Please... Tiny, please. Let me go...  help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny sits down on a stool next to the bed, he stares down Denise like a confused dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Please, God please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny begins preparing her food, carefully pouring the cer and milk into the bowl. He stirs it with the spoon. Tiny gently lifts Denise's head and feeds her like a baby Denise swallows the food, trying not to choke. After a fe spoonfuls Tiny stands up and walks over to a dark corner the room. He pulls a string and turns on a swinging ceiling light. the light we see a rusty cage, inside are three rail-thin female bodies. Tiny throws the remainder of the cereal into the cage. One of the bodies moves to eat the scraps, the others do  not. They are dead. Tiny turns off the overhead light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell and Naish are pulling into a large truck stop park lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this guy's supposed to ride  with us? Seems kind of weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning the parking  lot) Chief said pick him up and take him  with us on our house to house. Guy's  an ex-cop, thinks he can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a bad idea to me, probally  just get in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I guess it's tough to sit  on the sidelines and wait when your  own kid's missing... besides, ain't  no such thing as an ex-cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rundown gas station sits off to the side of the road. A filthy mechanic works on one of the many junked cars. Two fat greasy men sit in the hot sun playing cards. A Chevy Nova sits parked next to the station. Willis lean against the side of the car, drinking coffee from a styro cup. A police cruiser pulls up. Wydell and Naish step from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Willis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Wydell... this is Naish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell extends his hand, they shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George Willis... (to Wydell) ...any leads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we were on our way out to run  a check on a couple farmhouses out  on the edge of town... closest thing  we got to a lead at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, all we know is the kids were  headed out to a spot the locals call  Deadwood to play Nancy Drew with  some local legend about this character  everybody calls Dr. Satan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Satan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it's horseshit, just some  boogieman crap that the kids like to  scare each other with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, there's not much else out  that way... so, I figure maybe there's  a chance the kids broke down and  found their way over to one of the  farms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the body you found?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly surprised) Oh, yeah, you know about that? Hmmm,  that's a strange one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Local girl, Karen Murphy, been missing  for a couple months, figured for a  runaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fit the profile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really. Good kid, never been  in any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her part in this I can't figure...  but I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wipes his brow) Christ, you know it's crazy... (gets choked up) I lived through so many other people's  nightmares, you know. Always cool  and calm, but... but I never thought  I'd be the one needing help, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hit the road, sooner we get a  move on sooner we'll find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willis dumps out the remaining coffee, tosses the cup int the trash and opens the back door of the police car. He g inside. Wydell and Naish climb in. The car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on a bloody, bandaged face. THUMP! As we pull back to see Jerry, completely bandaged like a  mummy, strapped to a wall. His arms and legs are spread.  THUMP! Knives stick in the wall next to the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off screen) God damn bitch, what the fuck are  you waiting for... Charles Nelson  Reilly don't know shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back further to see Otis pacing wildly back and f in front of his TV, watching MATCH GAME. Grampa sits eati a TV dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing at the TV  with a knife) Watch that bitch, she's thinking  about that Klugman bangin' Brett  Sommers, pick motherfucking Richard  Dawson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis throws the large hunting knife at the wall next to J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the fucking slick jack Match  Game man, mamma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do they find these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, four kids couldn't just  disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No they couldn't, somebody had to  see something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Denise is a smart girl, she  wouldn't do anything stupid, and her  boyfriend, he always seemed like a  good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure there's a logical  explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pray to God there is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn up this road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we headed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seem to remember another farm set  way back off the road where the car  was found. I'm not sure if anyone  lives there anymore, but it's worth  a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell's cruiser turns up the road to the Firefly farmhou It moves past the scarecrows and comes to a halt. The doo swing open and Wydell, Naish and Willis get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna see if anybody's home. You  and Mr. Willis take a look around  the grounds for any sign of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... (to Willis) ...come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish and Willis head off around the back of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirty dishes overflow from the rusty metal sink onto the  surrounding counters. A large cat walks across piles of f left to rot on a table. Boxes of trash and old newspapers are stacked to the ceiling. Music from a crackling radio is heard. Mother stands stirring a large pot on the stove. A LOUD  knocking interrupts her cooking. She sets down her spoon walks to the front door. Before opening the door she peeks through the curtains of small side window. She sees Wydell and runs from the kitc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell walks up the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother runs toward a door at the end of the hall. She swi open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis! Otis! Come quick, there's cops  outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! God damn, how many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching TV) What? How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis jumps up and goes over to an old dresser and opens a drawer and pulls out an automatic revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I only saw one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure there's more than that...  fucking pigs always travel in packs... (handing the gun to  Mother) ...here, take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes the gun) What should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go down stairs and play nice... I'm  a gonna go 'round back and handle  things like I always fucking do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish and Willis move through the cluttered back yard of  garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, don't these packrat hillbillies  throw anything away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh... you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soft sound of moaning can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hear it... where's it coming  from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, inside the smokehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish and Willis stand in front of a brick smokehouse. Th thick door is chained shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knocking on door) Anybody in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moaning gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta break it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't got a warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willis picks up a broken axe handle and begins prying ope the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing hold to  help) Shit... fuck procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together they struggle to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother slowly opens the front door. The revolver is behin her back, tucked in her apron strings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be sexy) Well hello, officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up his badge) Excuse me, I'm sorry for disturbing  you this fine afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, you ain't disturbing me, but it  kind of looks like rain, don't ya  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Lt. Wydell, I'd like to  ask you a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Questions? Well, heck, I'll tell you  anything you want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your cooperation. I'm  looking for a missing girl... (holds up picture) ...this girl here, Denise Willis...  have you seen her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... mmmmm... no, I ain't seen  her, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to close the door. Wydell stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, could I please come in and  talk to you for a minute? Maybe you  could take a better look at the  picture... might stir up something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I um... no, I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, alright... I guess I can trust  you... being a man of the law and  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you are very welcome... Lord  knows how I love a man in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish and Willis bust open the door to the smokehouse. Ha upside down inside is Mary. She hangs from ropes strapped the ceiling. Large hunks of meat hang around her in the  cramped room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Wydell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell and Mother sit opposite eachother at the kitchen t Pictures of Denise and her companions are spread on the t Wydell takes notes as Mother talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think... do any of these kids look  familiar in any way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't say that I ever seen 'em  before... (points to the photo  of Bill) ...he looks familiar, is he on TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Naish's voice comes over Wydell's walkie-talkie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wydell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls walkie-talkie from his belt to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click. Mother points the gun at Wydell's head and fires. He falls dead to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish hears the commotion over his walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Wydell! Over! Wydell! Over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, go to the car... call for  backup. Tell 'em officer down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willis runs to the car, he gets about halfway there befor he is hit in the back by a bullet. He stumbles and falls his knees. He kneels silent, stunned. We hold on his face and watch his life passes before him. A quick MONTAGE, we see the following images flash by: A. A father and daughter together in happier times. B. A child's birthday party. C. A baby crying. D. Willis and his deceased wife. Otis fires another shot. Willis falls forward into the mud, dead. Naish sees Willis fall. Before he can react a voice calls out from behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands up, bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, real slow... piggy-pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interlock your fingers behind your  head... (Naish hesitates) ...do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish obeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kneel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naish kneels down. From a distance we see Otis standing over Naish, executio style. A white puff of smoke comes from Otis's gun and a  distant popping sound is heard. Naish falls over on his s The scene fades to blood red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house stands silent in the darkness. Lightning crashe a heavy rain falls. Burning JACK-O'-LANTERNS beam from every window. Smoke ri from the chimney. It is Halloween night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Wolfenstein is on screen smashing pumpkins with a gia hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is midnight my little boils and  ghouls, the witching hour. Time for  all monsters, murderers, maniacs and  madmen to go to work... so lock your  doors and bolt your windows, sit  back and prepare for a fright night  classic... (lightning crashes) ...The House of Frankenstein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The movie begins and we move off the TV to see: Hundreds of CANDLES are lit, illuminating everything with flickering light. Music blares from a cheap stereo. BLACK and ORANGE PAPER STREAMERS are draped from ceiling to flo Dead center is a LARGE OBJECT standing seven feet tall, i is completely covered in paper Halloween decorations. A l chain connects the object up into the rafters. This is the Halloween party from Hell. An intoxicated Grampa, dressed as FLASH GORDON, sits in h wheelchair watching the TV, drinking MOONSHINE from an  unmarked bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurred drunken  yelling at the screen) Get those motherfucker... those high  water bitches and rocketship  daisies... kill 'em, kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH! CRASH! CRASH! Tiny stands in a corner tunelessly  banging on a large oil drum. He is dressed like a low bud BATMAN, in grey long johns and a black bat mask and cape. A drunk Rufus, wearing a bloody police uniform, stands on table SHOUTING along to the music through a POLICE MEGAPH Mother and Baby, both dressed as SUPERHEROES, dance aroun the covered object. Both are swigging moonshine from jugs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting through  megaphone) Show me, show me, show me, show me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and Baby start TEARING AWAY the paper covering fro the object in the middle of the room. They RIP at the pap spinning and dancing around in a wild pagan ritual. As the shreds of colored paper fall to the floor we see:  Denise, Jerry and Mary tied back to back hanging from the chain, each are dressed in a different animal costume. De is a pig, Jerry is a donkey and Mary is a rabbit. They ar gagged. Mother and Baby laugh at their helpless victims, splashin moonshine in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up, it's party time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy your last night... (looking around) ...where's Otis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's coming, he got something  real special this year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus jumps down, begins to spin the bound captives aroun and around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis, Otis, Otis, Otis!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, quiet, you know he won't come  down with all this hoop-dee-doo  bouncing off the walls. Now, calm  down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shot an elephant in my pajamas  this morning... how he got in my  pajamas I'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grampa, shhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we tried to remove the tusks,  but they were embedded in so firmly  that we couldn't budge 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing at Grampa) Let him finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, in Alabama the Tuscaloosa,  but that's entirely irrelephant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes silent. All eyes are focused on the stairs. A robed figure, Otis, appears at the top of the stairs, h begins to descend. Rufus waits at the bottom of the stairs. As Otis reaches last step Rufus hands him the megaphone. Denise, Mary and Jerry struggle to watch as they in turn  rotate past the scene unfolding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the megaphone) I'm the one who brings the Christmas  candy... now tell me (pauses and raises  his arms) ...Who's your Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis walks closer to the rotating captives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who brings the devil's  brandy... (waits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I'm the one who beats you when  you're bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis stops the spinning of his prisoners and stands direc before Denise. He drops his robe, underneath he is wearing a SUIT OF SKI sewn together from pieces of Denise's father. Denise stares in horror, tears stream down her cheeks, ba able to comprehend the madness around her. Otis moves in close and licks her across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who loves you when you're  fucking dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone chants "Who's your Daddy?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Willis) Now, I say my little darlings... (rotates the chain to  Mary) maybe prancing around where you don't  belong ain't such a winner of an  idea... (slaps Mary across  the face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly turns the chain to face Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, the great rusher of fools,  what were you after... (slaps Jerry) Huh, speak to me... (slaps him again) Oh, that's right, Dr. Satan...  everybody got to know about Dr. Satan,  Jesus Christ, let the old dog rest  for fuck sake, he's already got one  foot in the grave and the other's  tap dancing around the edge... (gets nose to nose  with Jerry) ...well, I can see the disappointment  on your sad little puppy face... so  I'm gonna do you a favor, a big, big  favor. You owe me, boy. I'm gonna  let you meet the old bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a horse's ass alright, I told  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's eyes widen in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, roll that old love machine  over here, so this boy can meet his  hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby rolls Grampa over to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts his skin mask) You see it's all true, the boogieman  is real and you found him... (Jerry stares in shock) ...why so sad? Isn't this what you  begged for? There he is, the living  legend himself, ta da Dr. Satan.  Now, don't get shy on me... ask your  hero some questions, don't blow this  last in a lifetime opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarkoff, I will conquer the sea, the  air, the earth... the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother moves in close to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at the way he lights up... Grampa  just loves meeting his fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis grabs Jerry's cheeks and makes his face move like a  ventriloquist dummy, provides Jerry's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw gee whiz, I'm so excited... I  really think you're the coolest...  you're tops on the playground, cooler  than the Fonzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby grabs Mary and does the same ventriloquist routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, oh pick me, pick me... I have a  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby rotates Mary around to where Gramps is seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squeezing Mary's  face, hard) I was wondering Mr. Satan sir, do  you like to kiss on the first date  or is that considered slutty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you saying? Who  the hell is talking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny, growing restless, begins banging on his metal drum. KLANG - KLANG - KLANG. Rufus joins in, clapping his hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, my babies are getting  restless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump in the pit, dump in the pit,  dump in the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, Baby, Grampa join in chanting with Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. Cut 'em down, it's  time they get what they came here  for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain pounds down. A heavy fog hovers over the dense g of the field. In the distance, silhouetted by moonlight, gruesome caravan slowly moves through the night. Otis, lantern in hand, leads the way. Followed by Baby an Mother together under a large black umbrella. Next Rufus  holds the leash connected to Jerry, Denise and Mary. Bringing up the rear, Tiny, shotgun focused on the prison and Grampa. Grampa is strapped to Tiny's back like a chil He waves a flashlight back and forth like a search beam. The group comes to a halt at a huge wooden structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Baby the  lantern) Hold this. Point it over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby directs the light at Otis. We see that he is trying unlock a huge padlock attached to an iron door embedded i the base of the wooden structure. Otis unlocks the door and swings it open. He reaches down into the blackness and pulls up an iron hook and wench,  attached to the hook is a chain. Otis parts a section of the overgrown grass next to the p to reveal a rusty metal crank. He begins to turn the cran Slowly, from out of the pit, rises a coffin hanging from end of the chain. Otis pulls the coffin over and lays it flat on the ground He flips open the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey happy-boy, step your ass up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus cuts loose Jerry, but holds him steady by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take his gag out, it's more fun with  the screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I like the screaming too...  it's so much more exciting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus cuts loose the gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't kill us, please don't  kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Jerry) Please don't kill us, please don't  kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch, shut your mouth and get your  shit in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us go, please... let the girls  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imitating Jerry) Let us go, please... let the girls  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis pulls out a gun and points it at Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in... now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I want to say good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother grabs Jerry by the collar and gives him a big kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye sweety, we could of been great  together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, let us go, we won't tell  anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, honey you know I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis cocks the pistol. Jerry starts to slowly move toward the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, ain't this fucking a hoot...  alright mamma, I ain't got all fucking  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please this is insane. You  can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus pushes Jerry into the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is and I can... next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise starts kicking and fighting with Rufus. Rufus trie to hold her steady, when suddenly Mary breaks free and st to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs and raises  his pistol) Where's she think she's a gonna get  to? She's gonna run all the way home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Let me get her... (turns to Mother) ...Ma, Otis is having all the fun...  can I get her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true, Otis... not that we're  having a bad time, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) Well, go get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby jumps with excitement and runs off across the field  after Mary. Mary trips and falls over a small gravestone. She gets up and stumbles back into a wooden cross. She tears the gag  from her mouth and gasps for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There once was a woman who lived  with her daughter in a cabbage garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary turns toward the voice but sees nothing but wooden  crosses. She is in a homemade cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...along came a rabbit and ate up  all the cabbages. The woman said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary turns 360 degrees, but finds nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."Go into the garden and drive out  the rabbit"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! Mary is hit from behind, she falls forward. Baby JU on top of her and sits on her back. Baby is holding a lar hunting knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Shoo! Shoo!" said the maiden...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary screams in pain, as Baby PLUNGES the knife into her. Baby STABS Mary again and again and again. Mary lets out long gurgling scream, then goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..."Come maiden," said the rabbit... (leans down) ...sit on my tail and go with me to  my rabbit hutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, covered in blood, licks the knife clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis shoves Denise into the coffin with Jerry and locks t lid shut. Through a CROSS-SHAPED OPENING in the coffin we see them crushed together. Rufus LOWERS the coffin into the pit. Once the coffin is  inside Otis slams the door shut. Otis opens a small window in the door and lowers in a lan and a small tape recorder playing music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter Hell. The dim light of the lantern shines off the s wet filth of the rotted wood walls. The stench of death a decay hangs heavy in the thin air. Denise and Jerry, cold and shivering, hang half submerged thick maggot infested sludge. Bits of animal and human  skeletons float in the muck, broken bones lay in piles al the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the dim light, we see the tightly packed forms of Jerry and Denise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) We've got get out of here, we got  get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think, think. Try to open the lid,  try to kick a hole in the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) I can't... I can't move my arms. I  hurt so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but we can make it out of  here. We can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom! A LOUD THUMP is heard against the side of the coffi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good babe, just keep doing  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not me. I didn't... I'm not  doing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is out there... (shouting) ...help, we're in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help, help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, an arm breaks through the side of the coffin.  Another smashes through the top of the lid. The coffin be to violently shake. Denise screams. Another reaches through, grabbing her feet. SMASH! The co is ripped apart and Jerry is pulled away from the destruc He lets out a quick scream before disappearing into the  darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry! Jerry! Jerry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spastic light of TV static strobes across the sleepin face of Grampa. Beside him, Mother sleeps peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain has stopped. Tiny opens the doors to the barn. He goes inside. He exits a few moments later, dragging a  huge wooden stake. He sets the stake down carefully and c the barn doors. He then picks up the stake and drags it a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the farmhouse is a camouflage jungle, an intricate system of ropes and netting is strung together to hide th many automobiles beneath. Rufus moves through the jungle. He stops and begins to re the netting from a car, it is Wydell's police cruiser. He climbs inside the car, puts on Wydell's policeman's hat a starts the engine. He drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus is driving like a maniac through the open farmland. turns on the overhead flashing lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police cruiser twists and turns in the barren fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise stands knee deep in the sludge. Broken bits of the coffin's remains are scattered around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry please answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft moaning sound is heard coming from the other end o the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry... (moving slowly forward) ...is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise cautiously makes her way to the bend at the end of the tunnel. As she approaches, the moaning sound gets lou She turns the corner to see: TWO PALE FIGURES in filthy hospital gowns hunched over a  shadowy object. Denise gasps. They turn towards Denise,  revealing the partially devoured dead body of Jerry. The two bone-white ghouls are dripping with Jerry's blood they stare at Denise, then return to their prey. Denise screams in horror and runs, turning down another t in the underground maze. She turns the corner and runs  straight into SEVERAL SLOW MOVING GHOULS. The ghouls are the same deathly white complexion, hair-less with flaked, cracking skin. Their yellow eyes shine in the darkness. They reach for her, but she breaks free and continues to into the endless stretch of tunnels before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primitive wooden crosses form a circle around a burnt pie of land, approximately twenty feet in diameter. Laying flat in the center is the large stake, Mary's body draped across it. Tiny is securing her to the stake with  rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windshield, we see Baby jumping and dancing i the fields with several large dogs. She is firing a gun a she dances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby sees the car and raises her gun. She aims it at the driver. She waits, as the car gets closer she sees the fa of Rufus behind the wheel. She lowers the gun and begins laugh. The car stops and Baby climbs into the passenger's seat. car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny lifts the stake with Mary firmly strapped in place. implants it into the ground. Her body hangs like a doll.  Tiny opens a gasoline can and begins splashing gas onto t stake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis, face painted like a SKULL and wearing a priest's ro walks solemnly through the tall grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise, waist high in sludge, wanders lost through the en tunnels of the pit. In the distance she hears high pitche animal sounds. A GHOUL rises up from the sludge behind Denise. It stands silent. It reaches out a BONEY HAND with long curled  fingernails and grabs her hair. Denise screams and tries pull away. The ghoul grabs her with his other hand and pu her closer, CLAWING at her face. Denise fights her way free, but loses her footing and fal backwards, slipping under the sludge. She quickly resurfa and starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Otis stands in front of the bound Mary, holding a pumpkin Otis places the pumpkin over Mary's head. Tiny stands behind him holding a lit torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car drives wildly through the fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby motions to Rufus to steer the car towards the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beaten Denise struggles down a long tunnel. She gets to the end to find that it is a dead-end. Behind her, FIVE G move silently towards her, blocking her only exit. The ghouls slosh through the muck, moving in closer. Deni frantically looks for an escape, nailed into the wall nex to her are planks of wood forming a ladder. The ghouls are only a few yards away. Denise climbs up th ladder. They move in, clawing at her legs and feet, tryin to pull her down. Denise digs at the wood and mud ceiling above her, trying to break free. Denise is bleeding severely from the chunks of flesh bein torn from her legs. She digs wildly at the ceiling, sudde a board falls free and mud rains down to reveal: STARS, the sky above shines through the hole. Denise smas her fists at the rotted wood planks, pulling free another piece. With all her might Denise grabs hold and pulls herself up through the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise fights her way through the earth and pulls her bod up into the night air. The cool air rushes to her lungs. crawls free of the hole, gasping for air. She is safe. Suddenly... SMASH! A ghoul has broken throug the surface. He grabs Denise by the leg and begins to pul her back into the hole. Denise screams and begins kicking violently at the ghoul. She breaks and crawls from the ghoul's reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus and Baby have pulled the police cruiser up by the s Rufus and Baby stand on the hood. Otis finishes his sermon, he raises his arm. Tiny raises torch. Otis drops his arm, signaling Tiny. Tiny throws th torch onto the stake. The stake ignites into a huge FIREB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise pulls herself to her feet and begins to run. The flaming object burns in the distance behind her. Denise stumbles toward the road on two badly injured legs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus, Tiny and Baby jump up and down in celebration, sma the police car. Otis stands transfixed by the flames befo him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise makes her way out onto the road. No cars are in si In the distance headlights break through the darkness. De stands in the middle of the road. The TRUCK comes into view, it is a small cube truck. Denise stands in the headlights, waving her arms for it t stop. The truck comes to a halt. She runs toward the passenger's side door and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel of the truck is Captain Spaulding. Denise is shaking from shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go! Drive... drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, girly, what's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (becoming hysterical) Murdering... blood and Jerry... (starts to cry  uncontrollably) ...monsters... I... I... I got away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't see what the fuck you're  getting at, but I got some friends  that live just up this road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starts to turn the truck up the road back towards the  farmhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) No! No, that's it... that house is... (tries to open the  truck door) ...I gotta get out, I gotta get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom! The metal door leading to the back of the truck sli open. Ravelli grabs Denise and pulls her back into the ba of the truck. SLAM! The metal door shuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck quietly turns onto the dirt road leading up to farmhouse. The jack-o'-lanterns still burn in the windows grinning their evil grin.
